sourceMeaningMnemonic: You take a <radical>tree</radical> and <radical>slice</radical> it until you reach its <kanji>nucleus</kanji>. To get to the nucleus of the tree you have to make many a slice, but it’s possible.
meaningInfo: Imagine slicing this tree smaller and smaller until you finally get to the nucleus of it. It’s super tiny so you have to view it in a microscope. What does it look like?
readingMnemonic: It looks like a <reading>cock</reading> (<ja>かく</ja>). And by cock I mean a male chicken – a rooster. Why does the <kanji>nucleus</kanji> of a tree look like a cock? Science is weird.
readingInfo: Look at this tree nucleus that looks like a cock. While you’re watching it, the nucleus goes “Cock-a-doodle-doo!”
